reviews.text: A very beautiful place. Kind of an architectural wonder, the original style and renowned facades make it look really impressive. Besides, the church is very old and throughout centuries it has been one of the most important religious institutions. There is a place with a beautiful view over the city, but the entrance is not free of charge.

A very scenic cathedral.. unfortunately couldn't go inside but gives you a good picturesque view from the outside. The lane next to it had small shops with interesting local products. Also watch out for the art galleries nearby showcasing some work from the local and international artists. A place your can take a stroll in the evening..
Beautiful place. Just near Andriivskii descent. Its like mini flea market. You ca find interesting things
View from the hill is excellent. The color and architecture of the church is worth seeing.
The most beautiful place to visit rin Kiev. Highly recommended.
I have just took a look at this newly renovated palace for Ukraine's president. Worth visiting and especially enjoy view on the night city.
Very pretty castle. I wish I could go inside though.
Good views and nice little park3

It's the home of the President of Ukraine, Petro Poroschenko at time of publication. I didn't go inside, but the outside is quite nice and the park is lovely, even in the snow. Make it a part of any stroll in the area.
Noce palace. But close

The Perchersk Lavra is one of the best places I've ever seen! The monastery complex is huge and there is SO much to see. I would recommend seeing the main building, the caves and the folk and miniature art museum. It is all breathtaking and so beautiful. The caves are a wonderful experience, you don't have to be religious, just cover your hair and skin and remember to have some change to hand for your candle. This is a must see!! Oh and the bell tower offers spectacular views of the city!
Worthwhile visit. You must come and see this. The floor is very dark and not all the floor lights were working. Beware the path is steep and cobbled

The birthplace of Russian Orthodox Christianity. Equivalent to Vatican for Catolics. World class churches, museums, and views. For something more exotic, try to visit ancient underground caves where mummies of early Orthodox Saints are preserved - I am not sure it's still available, but worth searching out for literally out of this world experience.
Great place! Monastery with lots of museums inside! There is also museum of holograms - it's worth seeing)
A unique place to see. There’s spectacular view when you up to bell tower. So I definitely recommended. You must pay extra for taking professional photos but not for phone camera.

The Perchersk Lavra is one of the best places I've ever seen! The monastery complex is huge and there is SO much to see. I would recommend seeing the main building, the caves and the folk and miniature art museum. It is all breathtaking and so beautiful. The caves are a wonderful experience, you don't have to be religious, just cover your hair and skin and remember to have some change to hand for your candle. This is a must see!! Oh and the bell tower offers spectacular views of the city!
Worthwhile visit. You must come and see this. The floor is very dark and not all the floor lights were working. Beware the path is steep and cobbled

For something more exotic, try to visit ancient underground caves where mummies of early Orthodox Saints are preserved - I am not sure it's still available, but worth searching out for literally out of this world experience.
Great place! Monastery with lots of museums inside! There is also museum of holograms - it's worth seeing)
A unique place to see. There’s spectacular view when you up to bell tower. So I definitely recommended. You must pay extra for taking professional photos but not for phone camera.
It is like walking into a Klimt painting 😍👌
Nice place
Unfortunately, I don't know much about the orthodox tradition, I went inside when people were praying : it was an interresting experience.
Великолепный храм византийской архитектуры. Очень красивое внутреннее убранство сложенное из орнаментов, живописи, мрамора. Отличная акустика позволяет наслаждаться хоровым пением и богослужением.
Надзвичайно приємне і благодатне місце.
Wonderful place

Mağralar manastırı alanına 3 ücretli giriş kapısından biri. Üstü manastır şeklindeki kapı girişinin dış cephe boyaları ilgi cekici. Manastıra giriş ücreti gezeceğini yapılara göre ek ücretler talep edilmekte. Ayrıca fotoğraf ve video çekmek için bir hayli yüksek bir ücret ödemeniz gerekiyor. Bu kapıdan içeri girdikten sonra mutlaka arka yüzünede bakmayı ihmal etmeyin.
Супер красиво виглядає
小ぶりだけど内部も大変美しい教会
Прекрасна архітектура. Місце яке захоплює, що правда в хід аби помолитись коштує 25 грн. ((((((

Oh and the bell tower offers spectacular views of the city!

Фото та відеозйомка коштує 200 UAH. Касса на вході
Надзвичайна архітектура, обов'язково для відвідування!
Mağralar manastırına ücretli 3 giriş kapısından biri, üstü kilise olarak kullanılıyor. İçeride gezilecek müze çan kulesi ve diğer yapılar için ek ücretler ödemeniz gerekiyor.
Чудова церква!

Церковь имеет и еще одно назначение - вход на территорию Лавры .
Недалеко растет старый куст древовидного пиона .
Аромат при цветении - сногсшибательный .

I would recommend seeing the main building, the caves and the folk and miniature art museum. It is all breathtaking and so beautiful. Oh and the bell tower offers spectacular views of the city!

The St. Mary of Blachernae Church  is a Byzantine church in Berat, Albania. It is named after the famous Church of St. Mary of Blachernae, near the Palace of Blachernae in Constantinople. It is believed that the church was built on the foundations of a ruined 5th century church that existed at the same place. The church is regarded as one of Berat's most important historical and architectural monuments and is a key tourist attraction for both Berat and Albania.

The church dates mainly from the 13th century and contains impressive frescoes and icons on its interior walls and ground from the 16th century. The paintings that dates from the 16th century were mostly produced by Nicholas Onufri, the son of the more famous Onufri

It's amazing! The museum is huge and thoroughly lays out the history of Ukraine from the earliest times right up to the Maidan protests of 2014. The exhibits are well curated and the museum is well laid out. 90% of displays had English and it was very cheap. I spent a few hours here and really enjoyed getting to know this special country in real depth. A must see!!

If you are interested in the history of Ukraine you should definitely visit this place. A lot of artifacts represents culture of the nation who lived on the territory of our country for centuries.
Some of them are elder then pyramids in Egypt.

Must see,  but be ready for unfriendlyness, chaotic exposition, very sporadic English signs (usually name only), almost primitive guides clueless of surrounding history. 
Current exposition heavily stained by recent ideology shift, making a foreign visitor yearning even the former Soviet propaganda...

To compensate,  walk around the building: situated in an ancient history location. Get one of many local guides (through internet);
Views from this hill are most pleasant
Nice museum, good content, friendly people, but not a lot of information on individual items, and not a lot of translations into English

Really cool place to visit, first we were just going through but one worker asked us if we wanted an English tour through the museum. It was only 6 euro s for our own tour guide. Of course her English wasn't native but yet it was really interesting to see the history of Ukraine. And in my opinion they display it here really well

I found this interesting.  It is larger than it appears from the outside and has interesting photography and exhibits from the golden age of Ukrainian theater.  The room full of traditional musical instruments alone is worth the price of admission.  There are a few signs in English to help you out along the way.   You can also hire an English speaking guide for a tour.  After, check out the other museums on the Pechersk Lavra complex like the Micro Miniatures exhibit.

Цікавий музей.  Мені, як актору, було цікаво подивитись на зародження театру,  становлення  його і його сучасність. 
На мою думку,  треба більше сучасності у музей,  так, повинні бути експозиції,  як наприклад,  виглядав,  той чи інший костюм, чи за яким столом сидів Саксаганський.  Але можно внести більш сучасну ноту.  Є 3д панелі,  телевізори... 
Все одно, дуже сподобалось)

Люди!!! Кияни та гості міста!!! Відвідуйте цей прекрасний музей Театрального мистецтва, що знаходиться на теріторії Лаври!!! Дізнаєтесь про цікаві доробки нашого українськогомистецтва світового рівня!!! На вас чекають,щоб відкрити ще багато чого цікавого!!
Додаю фоторепортаж з виставки прекрасного, неперевершеного художника, сценографа Андрія Александровича-Дачевського!!!
Было интересно, стоит посетить хотя бы один раз.
Тем кто интересуется историей украинского театра, кино и музыки возможно понравится музей. А так обычный музей, скучновато
Beautiful monument!! Though be warned to reach there well in advance of 5pm. It closes earlier than other monuments. The campus is lovely too.

Its ok, nothing incredible, you have to pay entrance, not worthy unless you didn't travel in Europe and saw nice churches. The entrance to the territory will give you an understanding, but for each building they ask for a new payment. A bit ridiculous

The great spiritual place. It's really ancient and has artefacts of immeasurable historical significance. It's possible to just walk alone in the cathedral for a small admission, but I'd recommend joining a guided tour to get the qualified explanations about the cathedral and it's contents.
It's very nice and calm place. It has green and big garden that gives green apples and flowers. Al over I like it
Cool place to have a picnic. Good for spending a sunny afternoon. Very nice view from the cathedral.

Magnificent cathedral with bright yellow walls and blue domes with golden stars is sure to charm everyone, who visits it. The temple is a little dark inside, but in the same time very beautiful and interesting. This Cathedral is one of main and famous churches in Kyiv. It's historical building, that deserves to be visited.

My favorite Orthodox church in Kiev. Maybe not so amazing from the outside, with no golden domes etc, but the interior is the most stunning! A bit dark interior with richly decorated walls, choirs, candles and incense - and the very special religiousness of the East makes the visit absolutely unforgettable!
St Volodymyr's Cathedral is very ancient historical place in Kiev. It was founded during the Times of Kiev Rus althout still empresses us with its power and beauty.
This cathedral has a beautiful night lighting, unfortunately, my camera was unable to convey this, so better to visit this place and see everything live.

Great church.
Beautiful and magnificent

A very beautiful place. Kind of an architectural wonder, the original style and renowned facades make it look really impressive. Besides, the church is very old and throughout centuries it has been one of the most important religious institutions. There is a place with a beautiful view over the city, but the entrance is not free of charge.

A very scenic cathedral.. unfortunately couldn't go inside but gives you a good picturesque view from the outside. The lane next to it had small shops with interesting local products. Also watch out for the art galleries nearby showcasing some work from the local and international artists. A place your can take a stroll in the evening..
Beautiful place. Just near Andriivskii descent. Its like mini flea market. You ca find interesting things
View from the hill is excellent. The color and architecture of the church is worth seeing.
The most beautiful place to visit rin Kiev. Highly recommended.
Very underrated church, for tourists and residents alike. For a tiny fee you can see great architecture, and lovely art. Plus, the surrounding gardens are full of friendly cats...

More people should visit this church. Old and beautiful. The frescoes are amazing and well worth the tiny fee. The english speaking docent stayed late to explain a few of the murals.   No photos allowed, I wish they would charge people a bit more and allow it. If you go, consider bringing a small bit of food for the cats and dogs. A few seem to make it their adopted home.
Renovated old church with unique history. Good place to start a walk through Kyrylivs'kyi Hai park.
This monument should be promoted as a great touristic attraction
M. Vrubel. Wow. Really underrated in terms of tourists' visits. Carpe diem while you can enjoy it in silence.

Like tanks, gardens and  monuments this is the right place. In here you can see all sort of tanks with a small description on where they were used and produced. Also they have helicopters and planes out in the open, even if you don't want to enter the museum. You can even climb 3 of those in front of the Statue to take pictures for your social Media report! It's also home of big gardens where you don't hear the city noise and can relax and enjoy the sun and calm your Spirit.

Really interesting telling of Ukraine's military history, with some hard-hitting exhibits. The photograph gallery is amazing and the stories of some of Ukraine's military are impressive. Staff nudge you to keep on track and there are arrows on the floor to direct. Well worth a visit if you are interested in history and/or war.

Great collection of wheeled and tracked armoured vehicles, guns and some aircraft.
Not all in the best condition and you must brush up your language as most signs are in Ukrainian.
If you're visiting the Motherland statue this is  a must-see, just around the corner.

It is one of the largest museums in Ukraine (over 300 thousand exhibits) centered on the now famous 62-meter tall Motherland statue, which has become one of the best recognized landmarks of Kiev. The museum has been attended by over 21 million visitors.

The most amazing war museum. Very moving displays and amazing collection of vehicles and personal belongings from the country's history. Would love there to be English translations on the displays though.

I visited this museum before making the trip to Chernobyl and I found it to be a good accompaniment. I didn't have change for an audio guide but most of the exhibits had English explanations. The museum itself, although small, is well curated and very engaging. I found it personal, informative and I even saw some photos I had never seen before. Cheap entry, just take some cash. Staff were friendly. I would recommend.

It is rather interesting. But can not go one more time. I was expecting something better but it disappointed me a bit. Those photos inside the museum I can find online anyway and mostly you see photos. But it worth to see once, as it is cheap to enter anyway.
Nice place) Cool atmosphere, and a little sad all this happened
Very well worth the price. Not a big expozition but very interesting
great place to visit in Kiev.  Especially before visiting Zona

It's amazing! The museum is huge and thoroughly lays out the history of Ukraine from the earliest times right up to the Maidan protests of 2014. The exhibits are well curated and the museum is well laid out. 90% of displays had English and it was very cheap. I spent a few hours here and really enjoyed getting to know this special country in real depth. A must see!!

Really cool place to visit, first we were just going through but one worker asked us if we wanted an English tour through the museum. It was only 6 euro s for our own tour guide. Of course her English wasn't native but yet it was really interesting to see the history of Ukraine. And in my opinion they display it here really well

Must visit place if you live aviation. They’ve got everything you can imagine from soviet times. Also offering in cabin visit to some of their tupolevs. Very valuable experience for a dime. Get here is so easy , you can even walk from the terminal. They have a little hill as well if you wish to do some plane spotting . Sikorsky airport isn’t the main airport of Kiev so there isn’t to many traffic in there
Interesting place if you are into aviation. Getting here I would recommend taxi/Uber.

The museum has lots of machines from USSR, in a good condition. You can get inside planes and helicopters - but if you want so, you need full ticket. Also, museum located near Kyiv airport - you can check flights and see them from very close distance. Must see in Kyiv

Nice museum with massive selection of Soviet planes and helicopters. However, beware that the basic entrance fee does not include entrance to some massive planes which is definitely worth it (and costs next to nothing) so make sure to buy it upon entrance. Unfortunately, no member of staff speaks any English and they are a bit grumpy..
Really good. Very friendly people and very interesting. A must when visiting Kiev
The customer service is awful. Nobody came to help me.
wonderful place
Історичне місце, можна знайти дуже древні поховання, знаходив навіть воїнів УПА,  можна прослідкувати історію та архітектуру поховань

Ухоженное, чистое кладбище. На нем похоронены несколько выдающихся личностей, наиболее известен из которых летчик Нестеров. В центральной части находится церковь. При входе расположен музей кладбища в небольшом строении. Вдоль аллеек установлены лавочки для посетителей.
Варто відвідати.
Unique folklore place. Brilliant location. There many workshops and presentation. Polite sfaff. Love this place

Kyiv has dozens of museums - most are small, in need of updating, and the majority of them could be consolidated. This one is tiny - just a few rooms of paintings, clothes, and a few musical and other artifacts.  There is a lecture hall - if there is a talk in a language you understand it may be worth visiting but otherwise it isn't.
Museum purely dedicated to Ukraine diverse culture & art. Must to see place, when in Ukraine. Museum staff is humble and helpful. Small but very cozy museum.
Good place
Incredible museum with Ukrainian folk art :)

The most amazing war museum. Very moving displays and amazing collection of vehicles and personal belongings from the country's history. Would love there to be English translations on the displays though.
Цікаво дуже. хочеться дізнатись більше історії про це місце. звідки стільки даних про загиблих окупантах? на чиї гроші побудували меморіал?

Mein Grossonkel liegt hier. Vielen herzlichen Dank der Ukraine für das zur Verfügung gestellte Areal. Auch einen riesigen Dank an den Volksbund Deutsche Kriegsgräberfürsorge e.V. für die Pflege und die Verwaltung der Daten.
Оболонь как всегда на плаву но є проблеми з реалізацією через становище на сході україни
Крупнейший пивзавод
Єдиний Український пивоварний завод
Свежее пиво на разлив.
Всё как при Союзе, никаких перемен.

It is an amazing place to visit for at least once for the only reason - everybody should know how inappropriate behaviour of your country president may be while the Ukrainians starving around Ukraine. It is called  by people king's or sultan's mansion because it is situated near capital Kiev in almost 140 square hectares area, it is enormous massive. Now it is under management of ordinary people groups. It looks like that there is a little of order among those groups, but still worth to see yourself. Take a  golf car near the entrance, because wondering on feet will be hard in few hours.
Also known as the palace of corruption. A lovely park now. There is also a small zoo with few animals and pools with ducks. Even a stable with horses.
Great for walking with the family if one likes parks and link walks. Huge territory. No dogs allowed.
Amazing park, great huge area, zoo, river, lakes
Good in depth look at architecture across Kiev and also through history within Ukraine. Has many original artifacts dotted around a very large open area. Well worth a visit
Both amazing and disappointing at the same time. The historical aspect is mind blowing, but the iconography is way too much!

Great church.  Large square out front.  There was an original church with Mosaic floors that can be seen in some places.  This was destroyed by Samaritans, then the crusaders set up a church there and they got run out.  Last it was revolt by the Ottomans.  You can see parts from each period.  Good shops across the street and cafes.  Excellent wood carving store with everything made from Olive wood.  Masses are held in the church but they are all in Arabic.  People still have baptisms, funerals, weddings, etc. Above Jesus' birth cave.  Long line to get into the cave but with certain registered guides you can enter in reverse and bypass the line.  There is a silver Star on the floor under the altar in the cave which is supposed to be the birth site.  Then opposite that wall is the manger (stone trough) where baby Jesus was laid.
Very well kept. Important place to visit for anyone. Like stepping through a time machine.
Visiting the church requires a lot of time as there are many people waiting to go into the cave of Nativity it takes sometime even 3 hours of waiting in the line...

Church of Nativity is a must visit as it houses the birthplace of Christ. A little bit closer to Palestine than Israel but the site is beautiful and the house is designed in gold and shiny materials which lots up the arena.

The Perchersk Lavra is one of the best places I've ever seen! The monastery complex is huge and there is SO much to see. I would recommend seeing the main building, the caves and the folk and miniature art museum. It is all breathtaking and so beautiful. The caves are a wonderful experience, you don't have to be religious, just cover your hair and skin and remember to have some change to hand for your candle. This is a must see!! Oh and the bell tower offers spectacular views of the city!
Worthwhile visit. You must come and see this. The floor is very dark and not all the floor lights were working. Beware the path is steep and cobbled

The birthplace of Russian Orthodox Christianity. Equivalent to Vatican for Catolics. World class churches, museums, and views. For something more exotic, try to visit ancient underground caves where mummies of early Orthodox Saints are preserved - I am not sure it's still available, but worth searching out for literally out of this world experience.
Great place! Monastery with lots of museums inside! There is also museum of holograms - it's worth seeing)
A unique place to see. There’s spectacular view when you up to bell tower. So I definitely recommended. You must pay extra for taking professional photos but not for phone camera.
Nice station, good stores nearby. Just a few minute ride and you get to Khreshatik.
Звичайна промзона,мало людей,багато машин. Поруч річковий порт.
Хорошо, что обустроили небольшой скверик и убрали нагромождение киосков перед входом в метро.
Чистый и уютный хостел в центре Киева, адекватные и дружние соседи с порядочным и хорошим администратором.
Родные мкств. Прожмл здесь более 30 лет . Родились сыновья, это место их историческая родина. Улица Еленовская дом 34а

Magnificent cathedral with bright yellow walls and blue domes with golden stars is sure to charm everyone, who visits it. The temple is a little dark inside, but in the same time very beautiful and interesting. This Cathedral is one of main and famous churches in Kyiv. It's historical building, that deserves to be visited.

My favorite Orthodox church in Kiev. Maybe not so amazing from the outside, with no golden domes etc, but the interior is the most stunning! A bit dark interior with richly decorated walls, choirs, candles and incense - and the very special religiousness of the East makes the visit absolutely unforgettable!
St Volodymyr's Cathedral is very ancient historical place in Kiev. It was founded during the Times of Kiev Rus althout still empresses us with its power and beauty.
This cathedral has a beautiful night lighting, unfortunately, my camera was unable to convey this, so better to visit this place and see everything live.

Great church.
Beautiful and magnificent
First visit to Kiev and the borscht was so very welcome, nice and warming and very tasty! The pancakes/блины were amazing too! Warmed us up before we went back out into the freezing wind 😃
Food was good and tasty. Will visit again.
Delicious food and great atmosphere, really good prices traditional Ukrainian cuisine!
Nice place, good service, good food. Go for it!
Ate well for 30$ cad. Good traditional Ukrainian food. On a slow day. Borscht and salo for appetizers and ribs and cabbage rolls for the main. Would come back for sure.
good
Вкусно 😋 и уютно.
Вкусно очень, но кассиры теряются, у них надо выпрашивать салфетки, перец соль приборы
Платооо
Хорошая точка общественного питания, если нужно быстро и дёшево покушать, так чтобы накушаться - вам сюда

This place is value for money for local Ukrainian cuisine, this particular place is really big and good for all 3 meals without making a hole in your pocket. It has multiple floors so no problems of space like all other Ukrainian cafes which I don't like. It's a good place for business meeting and if you are coming with friends it's also good.
It’s one love;) Traditional Ukrainian cuisine, very tasty here with the usual price. I often eat there. Highly recommend!

Cafe to have a quick meal. Unlike most fast food places here you can buy cooked meal of Ukrainian cuisine. As it's a self-served Cafe the prices are not that high. Very comfy location just in a step from the biggest thermometer and Constitution square :)
Good place to get a lot of traditional Ukrainian cuisine for little money. Two floors and lots of space inside, nice 😃
Just super to spend time with lovely friends... And to test the drine vine...

Great cozy pub in the center of the city with good service and lower than average prices in the city center. The only drawback is they don't have an open air terrace in summer, so you can not enjoy the view while sipping the beer.
Probably the best pub in Kyiv
Great Pub. Anytime again.

Атмосфера шикарная!!! Пивко вкусное.. Все душевно. Испортила атмосферу официантка..Лена зовут. Оплатил счет, на чай лишь десять гривен..нежданчиком вышло дороже планированного. Подошла..спросила что не понравилось..почему так чаевых мало)))) Это жестяк..
Очень жаль что закрыли это очень атмосферное, уютное место с вкусной кухней и приятными людьми...

What a disappointment. Such a neat place with fantastic service, everything about this restaurant states quality at first. The starters are exquisite, ao are the desserts, but the main courses are nothing short of embarrassing. There is a huge dissonance between the different stages of the meal, as the first dishes and the desserts are absolutely brilliant but the main dishes that we ordered were comprised of over-cooked pasta that seemed as if a child prepared it (basic tomato sauce, 4 boiled shrimps as if straight from the supermarket) and a bulgur garnish that I simply cannot explain how distasteful it was - nothing about it was pleasant to one's palate.
Won't come back, simply does not worth the high prices.
Nice, fancy place with excellent food and service, pricy.
Exelenate resturant . Very good food with great service

Wonderful experience!  We stop there to eat lunch. I  have read other reviews for this place and everyone had only good things to say.
The atmosphere was very relaxing,  the music was soothing, the staff was very welcoming and attentive.
We wanted to try something new. And we had a great experience.
The chef prepared an Amuse-bouche that was very extravagant, sweet and savoury, a well balanced bite.
The Ikon salad had a great dressing, the caramelized carrots, golden potatoes and grilled chicken breast were very well seasoned. The greans were crunchy and extremely tasty.
My partner had a rib eye steak with golden potatoes and mushrooms and  Béarnaise sauce. The meat was medium rare as requested, tender and juicy and very tasty. The sauce was perfect.
For dessert we had the Debrecen Cake that was really divine. The cranberry sorbet was delicate and smooth, with white chocolate mouse and crumble, with caramelized walnuts and fresh cranberries.
We only drank water and cappuccino because we were travelling further that day but next time we will spent the day in Debrecen and try the local wine. They had a great selection of wine.
It was a wonderful rainy afternoon.
We are glad we stopped there to eat and we recomend the experience to all the travellers.
Thank you for a perfect day!

This is the best restaurant that I've visited in Debrecen.
Everything is perfect here:
The food, the service, the very professional (and English speaking) waiters, which are dressed respectfully. 
The decoration,  the atmosphere,  and the very clean toilets. 
Rarely me and my wife feel so satisfied after a dinner in a restaurant. 
We tried the goulash soup,  Foie gras, Risotto, Mulard breast, two cocktails, Debrecen cake and the divine creme brulee.
Highly recommended !!!
Great restaurant. Food is amazing. Service is great. Highly recommended!!!
Premium place, good food and service. Very nice interior. Good for business meetings
Very tasty food, experienced and willing to help staff!

Restaurant serves fusion food: Uzbek, Turkish, Tatars. Some dishes are significantly locally influenced.
All in al, menu list is very extensive and many will find something that taste very good for themselves.
Service is very decent. Atmosphere is relaxing and cozy.
Great service and wide variety of very tasty food
Great quality, nice and friendly personell, and not expensive!
Great pizza and salad. Small cozy pizza cafe. Inexpensive.
Cheap, fast and tasty
Маленькая уютная пицерийка с внимательным персоналом и ОБАЛДЕННО ВКУСНОЙ ПИЦЦОЙ!
Одна из лучших пиццерий в городе и приятный,внимательный персонал.

I’m a frequent visitor to Kiev. I love the restaurant. The food is good and the location is excellent. Their service has never disappointed me. It is quite a pleasure to have a dinner with friends on the open veranda, enjoying the view of the charming university park. The locals say they come here "выгуливать" иностранных гостей.” I come here “выгуливать” my local friends and family.
Really good Ukrainian food! More on the traditional side. But excellent service and a great experience! I definitely recommend and the location is perfect to walk around town!

Stunning place to eat, amazing atmosphere and looks great. And for the food ... Wow very tasty. The food looked amazing and staff were very friendly, and I can honestly say that over the week me and my partner have been in Kiev it is the best restaurant we have eaten in

By right, this can be considered one of the best Ukrainian restaurants in which the concept, the interior  is fully maintained. menu, music. Personally, all my friends and I really like it. Especially worth visiting this place when playing live music. Musicians are really great. Typical Ukrainian musicians. The only negative put is staff. I personally noticed and heard the discussion not from the best side of some of the guests. I think all guests should be on a par for staff. Clearly visible difference in the service of local and foreigners.
A great Ukrainian restaurant. Very reasonably priced. Mostly local people, which is always a good sign. I recommended.

Great place. Whether you'd like a delicious coffee or a four course dinner, you'll be well served there. The Atmosphere at Frenchie's is subtle, refined and artsy because the owner is an art collector. There is a broad collection of art literature, interesting catalogues and magazines spread across the space, which is another plus.

A little bit of France in Kiev. Always here when I'm in Kiev :-) 
Breakfast very good and tasty, recommended
Wonderful little place, staff were very polite and has a really cool French jazz club vibe, loved it!
Nice place for good cuisine
Nice place. Fish solyanka was delicious.

Отличный банк, все просто и понятно. 
Обслуживание на высшем уровне! Рекомендую)

Жуткий банк! Худший вариант в Киеве. За кредит вынесли мозг. Сумма погашения менялась ежедневно даже не смотря на зафиксированную с менеджером через Вайбер. Настоящие обманщики! Готовлю письмо в НацБанк на повторную проверку лицензии. Будьте осторожны!

Операторы в поддержке говорят одно. Кассир на кассе совершенно другое. После опять обращаешься в поддержку - получаешь ещё одну версию. Трудно придумать более непрофессиональный персонал. У некоторых сотрудников бонусом идёт цинизм и хамство.
Спасибо за то, что заменили рваную купюру.
Банк хороший, но кассирша - ужас, ещё и хамит клиентам
Fantastic sign outside of the cafe made me smile and go in and buy an ice cold beer on a very hot day

I wanted to like this place but found the food just very average compared to other Georgian restaurants and the quality. I ordered grilled veggies and they were a soggy mess shockingly...just strange.
Nice Georgian dishes
Super
Досить смачна кухня і гарне обслуговування. Підходить як місце для зустрічі з друзями.
Have been here quite a few times - all dishes tried/order always tasted very good. The service is fast and friendly. "The But" of the place is the priciness.

The food is just ok, really nothing special. People smoke cigarettes inside. The interior is nice, but the photos look much better than the reality. The service is good. Big plus - you can check in your coat.
Very tasty. One of the best lunches in the area. Prices are higher than average, but definitely worth it. Interior is top notch and the service is great.
Pretentious , does not deliver , people smoke inside , prices are high even for western standards , quality of food is nowhere near what you pay for .
Nice little place to have fun nighout
Perfect place for a dinner. Lovely and very polite staff, delicious food, great ambience and good prices. Definitely worth visiting :-) I will come back for sure !
Very tasty Ukrainian food. Nice music. Recommended!
Very attractive design,  politely personal,  and small surprise for guests in the entrance.  you can stay here in a small company or organise a team building.
Food Is ok, but really expensive for Kiev. Plenty of similar or better options for considerably  less
Delicious and really nice place!
Very good Japanese restaurant. Great food and loads of options, all very tasty.

This little place is hard to beat. The chirashi sushi lunch set was a generous portion, high in quality, including the rice, and very fair in price.  The side dishes were equally good.  The service was prompt and friendly. I will be back to try some of their other dishes.
Food Fresh and People friendly
Great food. Slightly pricey
Great quality of menu, excellent service. Highly Recommended.
The food was very good great service
Great Food, Great Prices, Awesome Service
Хорошее заведение! Кушали здесь вкусный и сытный ужин. Заказ принесли принесли в течении 15 минут. Приятный интерьер и вежливый персонал. Средний чек 500-600 грн.
Кушал тут завтрак. Очень вкусно. Персонал вроде внимательный.
Удобно.
